common-2.name: CeWL

common-3.name: Postman
common-3.description: Rich HTTP Client very useful to test Rest APIs.

common-4.name: FuzzDB
common-4.description: Dictionary of attack patterns and primitives for black-box application fault injection and resource discovery.

common-5.name: DirBuster
common-5.description: Tool useful to discover resources in a webserver using a bruteforce approach.

frameworks-1.name: Metasploit Framework
frameworks-1.description: Framework for exploitation and exploit development.

frameworks-3.name: Bettercap
frameworks-3.description: The Swiss Army knife for 802.11, BLE and Ethernet networks reconnaissance and MITM attacks.

anon-3.name: TORSocks
anon-3.description: Torifying wrapper used to redirect all the network traffic through the Tor

anon-4.name: ProxyChains-ng
anon-4.description: Preloader which hooks calls to sockets in dynamically linked programs and redirects it through one or more socks/http proxies

recon-1.name: Recon-NG
recon-1.description: Open Source Intelligence gathering tool aimed at reducing the time spent harvesting information from open sources.

recon-2.name: Photon
recon-2.description: Incredibly fast crawler designed for OSINT.

recon-3.name: theHarvester
recon-3.description: The tool gathers emails, names, subdomains, IPs and URLs using multiple public data sources.

recon-5.name: SkipTracer
recon-5.description: Tool for extracting metadata of public documents (pdf,doc,xls,ppt,etc) availables in the target websites.

recon-6.name: JustMetadata
recon-6.description: Gathers and analyzes metadata about IP addresses.

recon-7.name: SpiderFoot
recon-7.description: OSINT tool that integrates with just about every data source available and utilises a range of methods for data analysis, making that data easy to navigate.

recon-8.name: Maltego
recon-8.description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) and graphical link analysis tool for gathering and connecting information for investigative tasks.

recon-9.name: Maltego
recon-9.description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) and graphical link analysis tool for gathering and connecting information for investigative tasks.

weapon-2.name: CVE2017_8759
weapon-2.description: Exploit toolkit CVE-2017-8759 - v1.0 to test Microsoft .NET Framework RCE. It could generate a malicious RTF file and deliver metasploit / meterpreter / other payload to victim without any complex configuration.

weapon-3.name: CVE2017_8570
weapon-3.description: Composite Moniker. Demonstrates using the Packager.dll trick to drop an sct file into the %TEMP% directory, and then execute it using the primitive that the vulnerability provides.

weapon-4.name: CVE2017_0199
weapon-4.description: Exploit toolkit CVE-2017-0199 - v4.0 to test Microsoft Office RCE. It could generate a malicious RTF/PPSX file and deliver metasploit / meterpreter / other payload to victim without any complex configuration.

weapon-6.name: MALICIOUSMACROGENERATOR
weapon-6.description: Simple utility design to generate obfuscated macro that also include a AV / Sandboxes escape mechanism.

weapon-7.name: OFFICEDDEPAYLOADS
weapon-7.description: Collection of scripts and templates to generate Office documents embedded with the DDE, macro-less command execution technique.

weapon-8.name: DONTKILLMYCAT (DKMC)
weapon-8.description: tool that generates obfuscated shellcode that is stored inside of polyglot images. The image is 100% valid and also 100% valid shellcode.

weapon-9.name: EMBEDINHTML
weapon-9.description: Embed and hide any file in an HTML file.

weapon-10.name: MACRO_PACK
weapon-10.description: macro_pack will simplify antimalware solutions bypass and automatize the process from vb source to final Office document or other payload type.
